Class Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • Vector2
      • Direction

  • public class Direction
extends Vector2
    A class for representing a direction along the grid. Directions shouldn't have magnitude(only have values between -1 and 1) and shouldn't be diagonal(either x or y should be 0). (0, 0) is allowed as it can be used to say no direction.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Josiah Richards

      Constructor and Description

    • Method Detail

      • createFromString

        public static Direction createFromString(java.lang.String str)
        Creates a new direction from a string describing it (up, down, left, right).
        Parameters:
        str - The string representing the direction.
        Returns:
        A new direction of either up, down, left or right, returns null if the string is unknown.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts this direction to a string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Vector2
        Returns:
        The name of the direction e.g. "left", "none", returns null if it doesn't have a name.
